newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain cash bond market trade rose 44 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Spain cash bond market trade rose 44 pct in 1996.

text.p: Trading volume in Spain's cash government debt market rose 44 percent in 1996 to 1.46 trillion pesetas, the Bank of Spain reported on Tuesday.
In a statement it added that 446 trillion pesetas of that volume was among dealers holding an account in the cash bond market. A further 1.02 trillion was attributed to trading through third parties.
The central bank said Spain's total government debt rose to 35.95 trillion pesetas in 1996 with an average life of 4.86 years.
A total of 17.1 trillion pesetas of public debt will mature in 1997 versus 14.4 trillion pesetas in 1996, it added.
